title: 2023 Lamborghini Huracan Sterrato
description: This 2023 Lamborghini Huracán Sterrato is finished in Bianco Monocerus with multi-color livery decals over Nero Ade leather and Alcantara. The car was specified with the Grigio Style and Branding packages as well as carbon-fiber Sport seats, rally-style front light pods, black wheel arch flares, a central roof-mounted air intake, carbon-ceramic brakes, magnetorheological suspension, 19" Morus wheels, and three ANIMA driving modes plus a Sterrato-specific Rally mode. Power is provided by a 5.2-liter V10 that drives all four wheels through a seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle and a mechanically locking rear differential. Purchased new by the seller, this Sterrato has 2,700 miles and is now offered with a photocopy of a window sticker, a clean Carfax report, and a New Hampshire title.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 2023 Lamborghini Huracan Sterrato at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #193,602.
text: This 2023 Lamborghini Huracán Sterrato is finished in Bianco Monocerus with multi-color livery decals over Nero Ade leather and Alcantara. The car was specified with the Grigio Style and Branding packages as well as carbon-fiber Sport seats, rally-style front light pods, black wheel arch flares, a central roof-mounted air intake, carbon-ceramic brakes, magnetorheological suspension, 19″ Morus wheels, and three ANIMA driving modes plus a Sterrato-specific Rally mode. Power is provided by a 5.2-liter V10 that drives all four wheels through a seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle and a mechanically locking rear differential. Purchased new by the seller, this Sterrato has 2,700 miles and is now offered with a photocopy of a window sticker, a clean Carfax report, and a New Hampshire title. The car is finished in Bianco Monocerus with red and green livery decals and black “63” and 60th-anniversary decals over paint protection film. Sterrato-specific features comprise black wheel arch flares and rally-style front driving lights as well as a ride height approximately 44mm higher than the Hurácan EVO. Further exterior equipment includes LED lighting, a central roof-mounted air intake, Matte Black roof rails, a vented engine cover, a rearview camera, parking sensors, and twin Black exhaust outlets. The 19″ Morus forged wheels are mounted with Bridgestone Dueler tires. The Sterrato came standard with the Lamborghini Dinamica Veicolo Integrata (LDVI) system, which controls the torque vectoring, traction control, and all-wheel-drive systems, and stopping power is provided by carbon-ceramic disc brakes with red Lamborghini-branded calipers. The carbon-fiber Sport seats are trimmed in Nero Ade leather and Alcantara with red stitching, “Sterrato” script, headrest embroidery, and seatbelts. Dark Chrome and carbon-fiber trim adorn the interior, and Nero Alcantara covers the dashboard. Carbon-fiber door panels were specified on this example, along with Lamborghini Telemetry and aluminum floor mats. An engine start button is located in the center console beneath a hinged cover, and a fire extinguisher is mounted behind the passenger seat. The leather-wrapped flat-bottom steering wheel is equipped with a drive-mode selector that includes three separate ANIMA dynamic driving modes plus a Sterrato-specific Rally mode, and it sits ahead of column-mounted shift paddles. Instrumentation includes a configurable gauge panel with a 10k-rpm tachometer, a speedometer, and ancillary readouts. The digital odometer indicates 2,700 miles. The 5.2-liter V10 features dry-sump lubrication and was factory rated at 602 horsepower and 413 lb-ft of torque. Power is routed to all four wheels through a seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle and a mechanically locking rear differential. The window sticker notes initial delivery to Herb Chambers of Wayland in Massachusetts and lists factory equipment, colors, and options. The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage. There is currently a lien on the car, and the seller’s lender will need to be paid off before the title can be transferred to the next owner. You are not connected to real-time updates. html:
This 2023 Lamborghini Huracán Sterrato is finished in Bianco Monocerus with multi-color livery decals over Nero Ade leather and Alcantara. The car was specified with the Grigio Style and Branding packages as well as carbon-fiber Sport seats, rally-style front light pods, black wheel arch flares, a central roof-mounted air intake, carbon-ceramic brakes, magnetorheological suspension, 19″ Morus wheels, and three ANIMA driving modes plus a Sterrato-specific Rally mode. Power is provided by a 5.2-liter V10 that drives all four wheels through a seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle and a mechanically locking rear differential. Purchased new by the seller, this Sterrato has 2,700 miles and is now offered with a photocopy of a window sticker, a clean Carfax report, and a New Hampshire title.

The car is finished in Bianco Monocerus with red and green livery decals and black “63” and 60th-anniversary decals over paint protection film. Sterrato-specific features comprise black wheel arch flares and rally-style front driving lights as well as a ride height approximately 44mm higher than the Hurácan EVO. Further exterior equipment includes LED lighting, a central roof-mounted air intake, Matte Black roof rails, a vented engine cover, a rearview camera, parking sensors, and twin Black exhaust outlets.

The 19″ Morus forged wheels are mounted with Bridgestone Dueler tires. The Sterrato came standard with the Lamborghini Dinamica Veicolo Integrata (LDVI) system, which controls the torque vectoring, traction control, and all-wheel-drive systems, and stopping power is provided by carbon-ceramic disc brakes with red Lamborghini-branded calipers.

The carbon-fiber Sport seats are trimmed in Nero Ade leather and Alcantara with red stitching, “Sterrato” script, headrest embroidery, and seatbelts. Dark Chrome and carbon-fiber trim adorn the interior, and Nero Alcantara covers the dashboard. Carbon-fiber door panels were specified on this example, along with Lamborghini Telemetry and aluminum floor mats. An engine start button is located in the center console beneath a hinged cover, and a fire extinguisher is mounted behind the passenger seat.

The leather-wrapped flat-bottom steering wheel is equipped with a drive-mode selector that includes three separate ANIMA dynamic driving modes plus a Sterrato-specific Rally mode, and it sits ahead of column-mounted shift paddles. Instrumentation includes a configurable gauge panel with a 10k-rpm tachometer, a speedometer, and ancillary readouts. The digital odometer indicates 2,700 miles.

The 5.2-liter V10 features dry-sump lubrication and was factory rated at 602 horsepower and 413 lb-ft of torque. Power is routed to all four wheels through a seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle and a mechanically locking rear differential.

The window sticker notes initial delivery to Herb Chambers of Wayland in Massachusetts and lists factory equipment, colors, and options.

The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

There is currently a lien on the car, and the seller’s lender will need to be paid off before the title can be transferred to the next owner.
